    • Constructor Detail

      • BattleAI

        public BattleAI(Trainer player1,
                Trainer player2)
        Constructor of Battle. Sets each Trainer variable and loads the type chart.
        Parameters:
        player1 - Trainer to be considered as "Player 1"
        player2 - Trainer to be considered as "Player 2"

    • Method Detail

      • moveAI

        public void moveAI()
        This function is called whenever its the AI's turn to play. The AI will choose either to attack or switch pokemons.

      • switchAI

        public boolean switchAI()
        This function calculates whether the AI should switch pokemons or not. The criteria to switch is one of the following: - to be in a type disadvantage while not having a super-effective move against the target - have less or equal than 25% of the pokemons maximum health. Some restrictions: The AI can only switch when the switchAI attribute is >= 3, so that the frequency of switches is reasonable. The AI cannot switch when its party leader is the only pokemon that is still alive (the other 5 have all fainted). The AI must switch when its party leader has fainted.
        Returns:
        true if the AI should switch, false if the AI should attack

      • chooseSwitch

        public int chooseSwitch()
        Calculates and returns the index of the best pokemon that the AI trainer can switch to. Each pokemon in the AI's party besides the party leader will have points based on how good of a choice they are. This includes checking their current percentage of HP, checking if they have at least one super effective move against the target and if they are resistent to the target.
        Returns:
        the index of the best pokemon that the AI trainer can switch to

      • chooseMove

        public int chooseMove()
        Calculates and returns the index of the move that the AI will use. Each available move to the AI will have a score based on the factors that influence its effectiveness against the target. The chosen move has a 50% chance of being the move with the best score and the remaining chance of being chosen randomly.
        Returns:
        the index of the chosen move

      • maxScoreIndex

        public int maxScoreIndex(double[] points)
        Returns the index of the maximum value of an array of doubles.
        Parameters:
        points - array of doubles
        Returns:
        the index of the maximum value in the array

      • calculateScore

        public double calculateScore(Move move,
                             Pokemon self,
                             Pokemon target)
        Calculates and returns the score of a move, given the pokemon that will use it (self) and the one it will be used against (target). These scores pretend to simulate the expected damage that each move will deal to the target. However, the factors used to determine the scores do not take to account inaccessible information about the target pokemon, such as their stats.
        Parameters:
        move - move to use
        self - pokemon that uses the move
        target - pokemon which the move will be used against
        Returns:
        the score of the given move

      • hasSuperEffectiveAgainst

        public boolean hasSuperEffectiveAgainst(Pokemon self,
                                        Pokemon target)
        Returns true if the given pokemon has at least one super effectiv move against the target.
        Parameters:
        self - the pokemon that may have a super effective move
        target - the target pokemon
        Returns:
        true if the given pokemon has at least one super effective move against the target

      • isResistentTo

        public boolean isResistentTo(Pokemon self,
                             Pokemon enemy)
        Return true if the given pokemon is resistent to the target pokemon.
        Parameters:
        self - the pokemon that may be resistent to the target
        enemy - the target pokemon
        Returns:
        true if the given pokemon is resistent to the target pokemon.

      • isSuperEffectiveAgainst

        public boolean isSuperEffectiveAgainst(Move move,
                                       Pokemon target)
        Returns true if the given move is super effective against the target
        Parameters:
        move - move to be tested
        target - the target pokemon
        Returns:
        true if the given move is super effective against the target, false otherwise
